oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A carbon-13 NMR study of structurally characterized 1,3-dicarboxylato tetraorganodistannoxanes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JAIN, VK
MOKAL, VB
SATYANARAYANA, CVV
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: state c-13 nmr
ray crystal-structures
organotin carboxylates
x-ray
diorganotin(iv) complexes
spectroscopic properties
methyltin(iv) structure
molecular-structure
normal-bu
chemistry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: C-13 NMR spectra of structurally characterized different types of 1,3-dicarboxylato tetraorganodistannoxanes have been reported. In the solid state spectra, separate resonances for carbonyl carbons have been observed for distinctly bonded carboxylate groups in the molecule whereas a single resonance has been observed in solution. Variable temperature C-13 NMR data indicate that these molecules adopt a dynamic stereochemistry in solution.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INDIAN JOURNAL OF CHEMISTRY SECTION A-INORGANIC BIO-INORGANIC PHYSICAL THEORETICAL & ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, 38(3), 249-255
